overall.overall_text: a) communicate in various contexts and for a variety of purposes; b) demonstrate an understanding of simple oral texts, including short stories; c) demonstrate an understanding of vocabulary and language structures appropriate for this grade; e) demonstrate knowledge and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study.

specifics.specific: demonstrate an understanding of spoken language in various situations and contexts (e.g., summarize a Native story told to the class by a Native speaker from the community);
participate in a variety of structured oral language activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., classify nouns as animate or inanimate, identify kinds of verbs);
use the pronunciation used by Native speakers in the community;
participate in oral presentations (e.g., prepare a presentation on a Native tradition or custom).

overall.overall_text: a) communicate in various contexts and for a variety of purposes; b) demonstrate an understanding of vocabulary and language structures appropriate for this grade; c) demonstrate an understanding of elements of grammar appropriate for this grade; d) read a variety of print materials in the writing system used in the program; e) demonstrate knowledge and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study

specifics.specific: read a variety of simple written texts (e.g., traditional Native stories and legends, short stories by Native authors);
demonstrate an understanding of the information and ideas conveyed in written materials (e.g., identify the main ideas in short stories);
participate in a variety of structured reading activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., identify types of sentences in a written text);
use a variety of reading strategies appropriate for the grade (e.g., consider word endings, word order, context);
read sentences aloud using proper intonation to convey meaning.

overall.overall_text: a) communicate in various contexts and for a variety of purposes; b) demonstrate an understanding of vocabulary and language structures appropriate for this grade; c) demonstrate an understanding of elements of grammar appropriate for this grade; d) write for a variety of purposes in the writing system used in the program; e) demonstrate knowledge and understanding of aspects of the Native culture under study

specifics.specific: write a variety of materials (e.g., informal notes, letters, descriptions), using vocabulary and language structures appropriate for the grade;
participate in a variety of structured writing activities appropriate for the grade (e.g., describe an experience using different verb tenses);
use correct spelling in their writing, drawing on a variety of resources (e.g., classroom-displayed vocabulary lists, print and electronic dictionaries, spell-check feature of software programs);
demonstrate knowledge and understanding of aspects of the Native culture studied in their writing.
